subject: Re: [junit] Use of JExample for maintaining order of execution for  tests
msgSnippet: Does it mean that we do not have any answer to this question....? Is there a way to achieve this using JExample? ... -- Regards, Yogesh Patil. -- View this
messageBody:
Does it mean that we do not have any answer to this question....? Is there a
way to achieve this using JExample?


David Saff wrote:
>
> Sounds like a JExample bug to me, but I can't be sure.
>
> David Saff
>
> On Tue, Dec 22, 2009 at 1:29 AM, yogesh.patil <patilyogeshp@...>
> wrote:
>>
>> I am using JExample to make sure that all required test cases has been
>> executed before executing the test case which is dependent on others.
>>
>> But it seems like @AfterClass annotation stops working while running test
>> with JExample....
>>
>> At the same time @BeforeClass annotation works perfectly fine...
>>
>> Is it a bug in JExample or am I missing something?
>>
>> -----
>> --
>> Regards,
>> Yogesh Patil.
>> --
>> View this message in context:
